chargeHist.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (5th or 6th)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

01:28 PM Defendant Jesse J Hanson appeared by phone means.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of charged/max. penalties and rights. Mr. Hanson will be contacting the Public Defender to determine if qualifies.  Court reviews Mr. Hanson's employment and dependents.  Court urges Mr. Hanson to contact the PD office and if not eligible court will offer to appoint a county appointed attorney which is not a free attorney and would have to reimburse the county on a payment plan.  Mr. Hanson would be interested if not eligible.  Court will appoint Attorney Melissa Peterson in the event Mr. Hanson is not eligible and he would have to reimburse the county at the rate of $100/mo. com. 2/1 but call PD first.  If not eligible contact the COC for contact information for Ms. Peterson and she will represent you.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 16, 2021 at 01:30 pm.

Due to safety precautions currently in place with regard to COVID-19 (Coronavirus), in order to maintain public health and safety, you are to appear by phone. You should call (720) 740-9638 and enter access code 3937723 at 1:30 PM to be connected to the Court.
